intro: Erigeron guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. It produces white to pale blue flowers with yellow centers, and its leaves are usually hairy and lobed. Erigeron guatemalensis is often found in regions with temperate to tropical climates.
